text:
MATT LEWIS: I do
think that there

is a danger that we
may be misinterpreting
what's happening here.

Look, it's possible that there
is some there there, that there

was coordination, and that
Donald Trump's going to go down
in ignominy like Richard Nixon.

But I also think that there
is a chance-- you were talking

about putting this in
historical context,

the worst first 100 days or
whatever of any administration.
I think the world has changed.

And I think that it's a mistake
for us to sort of compare

Donald Trump to
normal presidents,

and even as recent
as Bill Clinton.
I mean, I feel like there's--

this is a new world, this
is a reality show now,
there's the death of outrage.

I think a lot of
average Americans--

DON LEMON: Matt, I love you.
MATT LEWIS: --out there--

DON LEMON: It sounds like
you're making excuses.
It doesn't matter if--

MATT LEWIS: No, but
Don, if you know me--

DON LEMON: --the average
Americans are believing a lie,

then they're believing a lie.
Or if they're misinformed--

MATT LEWIS: But do
you know me to--
DON LEMON: --they're--

MATT LEWIS: Have you ever
know me to make excuses--

DON LEMON: No, but it sounds
like you're making excuses--
MATT LEWIS: --for Donald Trump?

DON LEMON: --for misinformation,
you're making excuses for lies,

you're making excuses
for the evidence
that's all there in place.

The FBI director, the head of
the NSA, the Justice Department

all came out today saying
there was no information
that there was any wiretapping.

They did also say that
there's no information

so far of any coordination, but
they're still investigation.
They also-- investigating.

And they also say that
this investigation
has been going on since July.
Should we, because someone in--
you know, I'm making up--

an Iowa or believes
that, oh, well, people

are out to get the
president, in light

of all of this
information and fact

that we should go, OK, fine,
then it doesn't matter?
MATT LEWIS: No, no, no, no, no.

No, I'm not making
a value judgment,

or saying that everything
Donald Trump does is OK.

What I'm saying is I think that
a lot of Americans out there,

they're looking at us like
why are these people freaking
out and hyperventilating?

That, you know,
we're the problem.
So I'm doing analysis.

I think that we're out of
touch with a lot of Americans.

DON LEMON: Who's freaking
out and hyperventilating?

MATT LEWIS: I-- have you watched
the last I don't know how
many hours of cable news today?

DON LEMON: I don't see
people freaking out--
MATT LEWIS: I mean, we're not--

DON LEMON: --I think
people are incredulous--

MATT LEWIS: There's a
Supreme Court nominee today--

DON LEMON: OK, here's the thing.
MATT LEWIS: There was--

DON LEMON: And I have
a question about that.

MATT LEWIS: There's
a health care
bill coming up on Thursday.

But we're focused
100% on Russia.
DON LEMON: And I do--

MATT LEWIS: We're
not talking about

DON LEMON: --have a
question about that.
I do have a question about that.

But I think no one
is hyperventilating.

I saw a very
straightforward hearing.

Yes, there was partisanship from
the politicians who were there.

But from the two
gentlemen who were

sitting there
answering questions,
I did not see any partisanship.
I saw only facts.

And they answered
questions that they

could, and then did
not answer questions
that they could not answer.

There was no
hyperventilating, especially
from people on television.
I've not seen that.

I think people are
incredulous that in--

MATT LEWIS: This
is the worst day--

DON LEMON: --the face of all--
MATT LEWIS: --in the--

DON LEMON: But if you--
MATT LEWIS: --first 100 days.

DON LEMON: If you
look back on it,

it is a very bad period when
you look at the travel ban,

not being able to
get that through.

MATT LEWIS: How many bad
days did Donald Trump have
before he won the election?

He had a lot of
horrible worst days
of any presidential candidate--

DON LEMON: But that
doesn't mean that--

MATT LEWIS: --in
history, and he--

DON LEMON: --there isn't a
fact that he had bad days.
You're saying, OK, well maybe--

you're saying-- what
you're saying now
is alternative facts, Matt.

MATT LEWIS: If he goes to jail--
DON LEMON: That bad is good--

MATT LEWIS: --that'd
be a bad day.
DON LEMON: --and good is bad.

MATT LEWIS: But
otherwise, I think we're
probably a little overwrought.
